user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_timeout64:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_get_timeout64 (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
                   uint64_t *timeout64)
{
  uint64_t earliest_deadline;
  struct MHD_Connection *pos;
  struct MHD_Connection *earliest_tmot_conn; /**< the connection with earliest timeout */

#ifdef MHD_USE_THREADS
  mhd_assert ( (! MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon)) || \
               MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_ (daemon->tid) );
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */

  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_ (daemon))
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Illegal call to MHD_get_timeout.\n"));
#endif
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  if (daemon->data_already_pending
      || (NULL != daemon->cleanup_head)
      || daemon->resuming
      || daemon->have_new
      || daemon->shutdown)
  {
    /* Some data or connection statuses already waiting to be processed. */
    *timeout64 = 0;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
      ((NULL != daemon->eready_head)
#if defined(UPGRADE_SUPPORT) && defined(HTTPS_SUPPORT)
       || (NULL != daemon->eready_urh_head)
#endif /* UPGRADE_SUPPORT && HTTPS_SUPPORT */
      ) )
  {
    /* Some connection(s) already have some data pending. */
    *timeout64 = 0;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
#endif /* EPOLL_SUPPORT */

  earliest_tmot_conn = NULL;
  earliest_deadline = 0; /* mute compiler warning */
  /* normal timeouts are sorted, so we only need to look at the 'tail' (oldest) */
  pos = daemon->normal_timeout_tail;
  if ( (NULL != pos) &&
       (0 != pos->connection_timeout_ms) )
  {
    earliest_tmot_conn = pos;
    earliest_deadline = pos->last_activity + pos->connection_timeout_ms;
  }

  for (pos = daemon->manual_timeout_tail; NULL != pos; pos = pos->prevX)
  {
    if (0 != pos->connection_timeout_ms)
    {
      if ( (NULL == earliest_tmot_conn) ||
           (earliest_deadline - pos->last_activity >
            pos->connection_timeout_ms) )
      {
        earliest_tmot_conn = pos;
        earliest_deadline = pos->last_activity + pos->connection_timeout_ms;
      }
    }
  }

  if (NULL != earliest_tmot_conn)
  {
    *timeout64 = connection_get_wait (earliest_tmot_conn);
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I inspected the entire function for compiler-specific language extensions that are explicitly documented as extensions (e.g. GCC/Clang __attribute__ or __asm__, Microsoft __declspec, typeof, typeof_unqual, statement-expressions, inline-assembler, hex float literals, extended integer types, built-in compiler keywords, nonstandard pragmas, or other vendor-specific language constructs). None were found.

Specific checks and findings:
- No use of __attribute__, __asm__, __inline__ (compiler-specific spellings), __declspec, or other vendor attributes/keywords.
- No use of typeof, statement expressions ({ ... }) as an expression, or other GNU extensions.
- No inline assembly or pragma directives beyond standard #ifdef/#endif preprocessor conditionals.
- The backslash shown in the mhd_assert line is a standard preprocessor line-continuation (not a language extension).
- The /**< ... */ comment is a normal C /* ... */ comment containing a '<' character (commonly used for Doxygen), not a language extension.
- Use of uint64_t is from the standard stdint.h (C99), not a compiler extension.
- All constructs (enum return type, pointer usage, arithmetic on uint64_t, conditional compilation) are standard C features.

Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (use of language extensions).
